text: There is still some pb with Microsoft Office 365 with HubSpot and Sales Tools. *Is anyone know when it will be fix ?*
seems to be an issue with the cancel and close function on footer on a page editor : <https://www.useloom.com/share/91f55c50ab734cb289b9058cef485ce4>

HS might also want to check how they are targeting people on this page:
<https://www.HubSpot.com/financial-services>
the company its showing for the headline: "HubSpot And Financial Service Organizations like ...." is not the company I am with lol
not sure why they bother using smart content here
"HubSpot And Financial Service Organizations like your company" is the incognito
Thanks for flagging this guys. We're taking out the Smart Content now. It was for a particular campaign that isn't running anymore.

Hi I'm on the phone with support also - but thought I'd also see if any HubSpot Staff here can chime in if they think they know what's going on.

This website's stylesheet isn't properly loading, it appears the hubl inside isn't being processed, in the back end there's no errors occuring when saving the stylesheet.

The stylesheet was unedited for about a week, and suddenly today is experiencing this issue.

<http://www.herbein.com/>

Something seems to be up with how the stylesheet gets loaded, it's not using the normal url
<http://spin.d.pr/uK8e0I+>
looks like your `HER17-styles.css` is missing info at the bottom
good observation, looks like there's an issue processing the @supports
looks like you got it back up, what was the issue?
Thanks for catching that I was able to get it back up thanks to that. HubSpot's pre-processor is a little touchy on @supports.
I was missing a space in one spot and that broke it
the browser can handle not having that space - but the pre processor evidently needed it
site is nice looking btw, you do that with the drag n drop or code?
Where was the missing space? Iâ€™d like to look into this
